content.description: Consider the logistic differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>y</mi> <mn>8</mn> </mfrac> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43AF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let y = f(t) be the particular solution to the differential equation with f(0) = 8.
content.question: Write the second-degree Taylor polynomial for f about t = 0, and use it to approximate f (1).

frqParts.text: Write the second-degree Taylor polynomial for f about t = 0, and use it to approximate f (1).

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
